column5: Well with the weather being the way it is, its hard to pass up a day on the water.  Cal and I had to work today, but we got on the water by about 4:30 and fished til 7:15  In those 3 "ish" hours of fishing, I had the most fun I've ever had while fishing!  Cal and I caught almost 30 fish, all between 3 and 5 pounds, literally nothing smaller than 3.  Absolutely incredible day on the water.  Finesse was key with the glass flat water, but they were eating if you slowed down enough.      Awesome Day!  I will never forget it
P.S. The top fish was released before our "final photos" because she was hooked kind of deep and didnt want to risk holding her in a livewell if we didnt have to
oh yeah  some fine looking fish there
Nice fish Steve what was the bait of choice?
soft jerkbaits at the start, good old tube towards the end
soft jerkbaits at the start, good old tube towards the end
Nice looking fish.  That must have been really fun.
Very impressive Steve. I love the colours on those smallies. Fantastic few hours on the water for you both. Congrats and thanks for sharing.
Nice fish Steve. You werent even close.  LOL  See ya out there Sunday.
WTG Steve  Very nice smallies for sure!  Lots of fun when the biting is on!  Thanks for sharing Leechman
calmest day I've ever seen out there
right on pal, nice fish for sure.

Nice fish Steve-I was out there also on tues, what a nice day! my freind Murray caught his PB 6.4 lber! talk about happy, great when you can run the lake all day, we hit ours shallow, how about you and Cal?
Very nice!We were also out a few hours that evening. We only caught one 4lber and a few smaller ones. But we also targeted largies and Alex hooked a 4lber and we caught a few other smaller ones.
Just curious if you are fishing the north side or south side of simcoe?  Great looking catch.
